eg.projects

Class AbstractProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.projects.AbstractProject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericProject, HtmlProject, JavaProject, PerlProject, RProject

    public abstract class AbstractProject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable
    The configuration of a project

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProject

        protected AbstractProject(ProjectTypes projType,
                          boolean useMainFile,
                          java.lang.String sourceExtension)
        Parameters:
        projType - the project type which has a valaue in ProjectTypes
        useMainFile - true to indicate that the project uses a main file which is executed when the project is run
        sourceExtension - the extension without the period of source files (or of the main file if extensions differ)

    • Method Detail

      • setConfiguringAction

        public final void setConfiguringAction(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Sets the ActionListener that is called when the entries in the settings window are confirmed. The listener calls Configurable.configure(java.lang.String) and assigns/updates the project if the configuration is successful
        Specified by:
        setConfiguringAction in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        al - the ActionListener

        public final boolean configure(java.lang.String dir)
        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Configures a project based on the entries in the settings window
        Specified by:
        configure in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in the project directory named in the settings window
        Returns:
        true indicates a successful configuration

      • retrieve

        public final boolean retrieve(java.lang.String dir)
        Tries to retrieve a project stored in a preferences file.

        It is tried to find a 'ProjConfig' file in dir or further upward the directory path. The project is the directory where the file is found. If it is not found, it is tested if dir is contained in the recent project saved in the "Prefs" file in the program folder.

        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in a stored project
        Returns:
        true indicates that a saved project could be retrieved

        Description copied from interface: Configurable

        Specified by:
        projectType in interface Configurable
        Returns:
        the type of project which is a constant in ProjectTypes

        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Returns if the project uses a main file that is executed when the project is run
        Specified by:
        usesProjectFile in interface Configurable
        Returns:

        public final java.lang.String executableDirName()

      • namespace

        protected java.lang.String namespace()
        Returns the namespace of the main file. This is a relative directory or directory path based at the sources directory or, if a sources directory is not given, at the project's root directory.
        Returns:
        the namespace. The empty string if no namespace is given

      • sourceDirName

        protected java.lang.String sourceDirName()

        Returns:
        the name. The empty string if no source directory is given

      • sourceExtension

        protected java.lang.String sourceExtension()
        Returns the extension of source files (or of the main project file if extensions differ) with the beginning period
        Returns:
        the extension. Null if no source extension is given
